medical_history.chief_complaint: Epigastric, bandlike, constant pain with light colored stools, dark urine, and pruritis for 10 days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 10 days prior to presentation. The pain was constant, bandlike in nature, and was accompanied by light colored stools, dark urine, and pruritis. Symptoms were aggravated, leading to liver function tests that revealed elevations.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1. Panic attack, anxiety, depression. 2. Gastroesophageal reflux. 3. Hiatal hernia. 4. Hyperlipidemia. 5. Glucose intolerance, borderline diabetes mellitus type 2. 6. Fatty liver. 7. History of plantar fasciitis. 8. Iron deficiency anemia. 9. Migraine headaches. 10. Allergic rhinitis. 11. Bilateral carpal tunnel syndrome. 12. Right breast ductal hyperplasia.
medical_history.family_history: Father with lung cancer. Mother and sisters with gallbladder disease.
